name: How much do you know about Alabama Football? | Quiz

questions.text: The Universtiy of Alabama was founded in 1831, but in which year did they play the first football game in school history?
questions.explanation:
1892.

	The first game that the Crimson Tide ever played was against Birmingham High School on Nov. 11, 1892. The next day in a rematch Birmingham High won 5-4. The two teams played once more that season with Alabama coming out on top 14-0.

questions.text: What was significant about the 1918 season at Alabama?
questions.correct: The season was cancelled due to WWI
options: The first winless season in school history
The first unbeaten team in school history
The first national championship in school history
questions.explanation:
The season was cancelled due to WWI.

	Alabama was just one of many schools to cancel all non-academic activities during WWI.

questions.text: The Crimson Tide football team played in the school's first bowl game in 1925. What bowl did they play in that year?
questions.explanation:
Rose Bowl.

	The Crimson Tide defeated Washington 20-19 in the Rose Bowl, and capped off a perfect 10-0 season. They were actually the fifth team selected for the Rose Bowl that season. Washingon accepted a bowl bid then Dartmouth, Yale and Colgate all turned down chances to play them before Alabama accepted.

questions.text: In 1992, Alabama fans selected the all-centennial team. Kenny Stabler was elected the back-up QB.  Who was selected to be the starter?
questions.explanation:
Namath & Joe Namath.

	Namath quarterbacked the team from 1962-64, and Stabler from 1965-67. Namath passed for a then school record 2,714 yards in his three years at the helm. Paul "Bear" Bryant was selected as the coach of this team for posting a 232-46-9 record while at the school.

questions.text: Shaun Alexander set a lot of school records during his time (1996-99) in a 'Bama' uniform. These records included most rushing yards in a single game.  What year did he break the single game mark?
questions.explanation:
1996 (Freshman).

	He rushed for 291 yards in just his eighth collegiate game. This was on Nov. 1996 in a 26-0 victory over LSU.

questions.text: Joe Namath and Shaun Alexander are considered the two best players in Crimson Tide history.  Were either of them an All-American?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Neither of them were an All-American. The first offensive skill position player from Alabama, to be named an All-American, was Ozzie Newsome (WR) in 1977.

questions.text: How many National Championships did the University of Alabama win in the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
12.

	The Crimson Tide had won or shared 12 National Championships, seven of which were in the "modern era" (1936-present). The school also won 21 South Eastern Conference championships, 16 of which were out-right titles.

questions.text: Who was the first All-American to wear an Alabama jersey?
questions.explanation:
Fred Sington.

	Sington, who was an All-American in 1930, was the only player on the list to earn that distinction. The others all held school records at Alabama, but were never All-Americans.

questions.text: Did Rudyard Kipling's poem, "The Thin Red Line", have anything to due with Alabama?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The Crimson Tide were named in part through that poem. The Crimson part was due to the early team's all wearing red stockings. The tide part came into being when a sports writer who had been reffering to the team as a line of red called them a tide during an extremely rainy game. Thus the Crimson Tide came into being.

questions.text: The first coach in school history was E.B. Beaumont who went 2-2 in his career. Who was the last man to coach the team in the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
Mike DuBose.

	DuBose took over the team from Gene Stallings in 1997, and compiled a 24-23 record during the four years he spent at the school. He was replaced after a 3-8 season in 2000 by Dennis Franchione. Franchione was replaced after two seasons by Mike Shula. Bryant is considered the best coach in school history posting a .824 winning percentage in 25 seasons at Alabama.
